nuggets.text: VEED.IO homepage states "No credit card required" for sign up.
VEED.IO homepage shows "Rated 4.6 out of 5 on G2."
VEED.IO homepage claims "2M+ video & audio assets."
VEED.IO homepage shows "4.9/5 — based on 6.7k reviews."
VEED.IO homepage claims "Trusted by 4M+ creators and teams."

VEED terms state the provider will implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect Personal Data against accidental, unauthorised or unlawful processing and against loss or damage.
VEED terms list example security measures including pseudonymisation and encryption of personal data and a process for regularly testing and evaluating security effectiveness.
VEED terms state the provider will notify the customer in writing as soon as reasonably practicable if it becomes aware of a Personal Data Breach or certain loss/unauthorised processing events.
VEED terms state VEED uses subcontractors to provide infrastructure and services; by using the apps, users agree to subcontractors’ sub-processing of data.
VEED privacy policy states it does not sell personal data to third parties.
VEED privacy policy states it generally does not rely on consent as a legal basis, except for Special Categories of Personal Data (where applicable) and automated decisions (where applicable).

VEED privacy policy states it will only retain personal data for as long as reasonably necessary to fulfil purposes collected for, and may retain longer in the event of a complaint or prospect of litigation.
VEED privacy policy states UUIDs used for analytics/preferences persist between launches and updates but are lost when the programme is deleted; a new UUID is generated on reinstall.
VEED privacy policy states it may anonymise personal data for research/statistical purposes and may use that anonymised information indefinitely without further notice.

VEED privacy policy states that for free-tier users who request erasure of personal data used for development and improvement processing, VEED will delete that personal data when there is no other valid reason to retain it.

VEED privacy policy states it may continue to use information derived through development and improvement processing if it is deidentified, anonymised, and/or aggregated so it no longer identifies the user or content.
Projects exported while not logged in or using a free account will have a VEED.IO watermark.
The article states the only way to export a project without the watermark is to have a paid subscription.
The watermark cannot be edited or moved and is described as always being on the top-right side of the video.
Embedded videos will have a watermark on a Free subscription; embedding without a watermark requires a Pro or Enterprise subscription.
If you are in the wrong account/workspace (e.g., workspace shows "Free"), exports may still include a watermark.
Projects exported before subscribing will still have a watermark; you must re-export the original project after subscribing.
The watermark is described as hardcoded into the video file during export and cannot be removed from an already-downloaded watermarked file by subscribing later.
If the last subscription payment failed, the subscription can be put on hold and the workspace can be temporarily on the Free plan.
The article states monthly billing is not available in India due to Reserve Bank of India regulations and only annual plans are offered for Indian users.
Canceling auto-renewal stops renewal at the end of the billing period and you retain access to premium features until the current billing cycle ends.
Subscriptions auto-renew by default unless canceled.
Each workspace has its own subscription; users in multiple workspaces must manage each subscription individually.
Upgrading to a higher plan resets the billing period and charges a full subscription cycle starting from the new billing date; unused time is described as prorated and deducted from the total.
Support hours are stated as Monday to Friday during business hours, with no support offered on weekends.
Typical reply times listed: Live Chat (Paid plans) 4–8 business hours; Live Chat (Enterprise) under 20 minutes; Email (All users) within 3 business days.
The article states Free users have email support available but live chat is not available.
The article states paid users have live chat and email support available; Enterprise has priority support for live chat and email.
The article recommends using Google Chrome because the editor runs best there.
The article recommends keeping the browser up to date and having VPN disabled to avoid most issues.
To report project/exporting issues, the article asks for the project link (URL) plus details of the issue, steps before it appeared, and how results differ from expected.
The support article directs users to VEED’s privacy policy at https://www.veed.io/privacy.
help.veed.io displays a "We’re here to help" section linking to categories including Getting Started, How to use VEED, VEED for Teams, Account and Subscription, Issues and Feedback, and FAQ.
Trim, crop, and add text with drag-and-drop simplicity directly in the browser.
Supports adding subtitles, removing background noise, and cleaning audio.
Exports videos in up to 4K resolution.
Free users can export videos in 720p with a watermark.
Works on Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge, and Firefox browsers.
Includes AI tools like Magic Cut to remove silences and filler words.
Generates videos from text prompts including visuals and narration.
Access to AI video models like Veo 3, Kling, and Hailuo AI.
Fabric 1.0 model supports talking head videos up to 60 seconds long.
Users can generate initial videos and customize scenes with AI-generated media.
Supports generating videos for YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok.
Commercial use of generated videos is permitted.
Records screen, webcam, and audio directly from the browser.
Allows choosing layouts like screen only, webcam only, or both.
Offers unlimited retakes for recordings.
Includes AI eye contact correction tool.
Recordings can be edited immediately in the built-in video editor.
Compatible with Windows, Mac, and Linux.
Automatically generates subtitles for video and audio files.
Exports subtitles as SRT, VTT, or TXT files.
Supports translation of subtitles into multiple languages.
Allows burning or hardcoding subtitles directly into the video.
Users can customize subtitle font, size, style, and colors.
Generating and adding subtitles is free for everyone.
Converts written text into narrations in 50+ languages.
Supports converting up to 5,000 characters to speech per video project.
Users can select from male and female AI voice profiles.
Allows previewing the speech before adding it to the project.
Can download the project as an MP3 audio file.
Supports adding AI avatars to read the written content.
Resizes videos for platforms like YouTube (16:9), Instagram Story (9:16), and TikTok (9:16).
Supports exporting in 480p, 720p, 1080p, and 4K resolutions.
Compatible with MP4, AVI, MOV, and other video formats.
Allows cropping video to fit dimensions.
Works on Mac, Windows, iPhone, iPad, and Android devices.
Resizing functionality is free to use.
Turns static images into video clips based on text prompts.
Supports uploading JPG, PNG, and WebP image formats.
Users can describe desired movements like walking, panning, or zooming.
Free version includes a watermark on the generated video.
Generated video appears as a scene in the editor.
Allows adding animated stickers and music to the generated video.
Converts text to speech instantly with realistic AI voice profiles.
Supports adding up to 1,000 characters per conversion for free users.
Users can preview the selected voice before adding to the project.
Allows downloading projects as audio files.
Can be used as a voice changer for Discord and gaming.
Offers both male and female voice options.
Translates videos into 29 languages with voice preservation.
Supports lipsync enabling for realistic video translation.
Generates subtitles in over 125 languages.
Claims 99.9% accuracy in translations.
Allows downloading translated subtitles as TXT, VTT, or SRT files.
Can retain background audio during translation.
Requires recording a short script to create a voice clone.
Voice clones can be used with text-to-speech to read any text.
Exports voice clone audio as MP3 files.
Prohibits impersonation of others; users can only clone their own voice.
Free users can try the tool, but full access requires a Pro plan.
Supports creating custom voiceovers for global content scaling.
Automatically removes wind noise, AC hums, and background chatter.
Supports MP4, MOV, AVI, MKV, FLV, and MPEG video formats.
Powered by Dolby technology.
Free to try, but continued use requires a Pro upgrade.
Can remove filler words like 'um' and 'er' with Magic Cut.
Users can toggle 'Clean audio' off to compare results.
Compresses videos up to 1GB for free.
Supports MP4, MOV, AVI, MKV, WEBM, WMV, and GIF formats.
Allows adjusting compression via a slider for size vs quality balance.
Can downscale 4K videos to 1080p or 720p.
Advanced settings allow changing bitrate, FPS, and CRF.
Shows real-time file size estimates during adjustment.
Supports uploading MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, and OGG formats.
Transcribes audio with up to 99.9% accuracy.
Supports transcription in over 125 languages.
Paid users can export transcripts as TXT, SRT, or VTT files.
Allows editing transcript text directly in the editor.
Can translate transcripts instantly to other languages.
Dubs audio with voice preservation in over 25 languages.
Generates subtitles across 125+ languages.
Supports input formats like MP3, WAV, M4A, and MP4.
Allows exporting translation as subtitled video, dubbed audio, or text transcript.
Pro users can download transcripts as TXT, SRT, or VTT files.
Free to try, but higher translation limits require a Pro plan.
VEED groups its workflow into Create, Edit, and Publish sections.
Recorder tools listed include Screen Recorder, Teleprompter, Voice Recorder, Webcam Recorder, and Slides to Video Converter.
Captions & Translations tools listed include Auto Subtitle Generator, Audio to Text, Video to Text, and Video Translator.
Under 'Text To Video', VEED lists AI Avatars, AI Reel Generator, Text to Video AI, VEO3, and Seedance.
Under 'AI Video Models', VEED lists models including Kling O1, VEO 3.1, Sora 2, Hailuo 02, and Wan 2.2.
Under 'AI Video APIs', VEED lists Fabric 1.0 API, AI Lip Sync API, Green Screen API, Background Removal API, and Background Removal Fast API.
The VEED Tools page lists tool categories including Recorder, Video Editor, Captions & Translations, and Publish.
The VEED Tools page includes a Create section with Recorder, Script Generator, Video GPT, and AI Avatars.
The VEED Tools page includes an Edit section with Video Editor, Translations, and Subtitles.
In the AI section, VEED groups tools into Avatars & AI Voices, AI Editing, and AI Generation.
In the AI section, VEED lists Text To Video tools including AI Avatars, AI Reel Generator, Text to Video AI, VEO3, and Seedance.
In the AI Video Models list, VEED includes entries such as Fabric 1.0, Kling O1, VEO 3.1, and Sora 2 Pro.
You can describe the video you want to create, click a pre-made prompt, or paste a script or article.
For direct text-to-video conversion, the tool lets you tell the AI to use your text verbatim.
Step 2 lets you choose the format, avatar or voiceover, music, and caption style.
The workflow mentions replacing footage with your own media, stock videos, or generative AI clips.
Step 3 says clicking 'Done' exports your video or you can open the video editor to keep editing.
The page says you can create a custom avatar or voice clone to personalize your content further.
The AI video maker says it can create videos with clips, music, voiceovers, captions, and animations without your own footage.
The page says you can describe the video, select a style, and generate it using VEED's AI video generator.
The page states you can add an AI avatar to your AI-generated video.
It says you can generate voiceovers from text and choose from diverse AI voices.
It says you can clone your voice for a more personal touch.
The page describes refining videos using an intuitive timeline and drag-and-drop interface.
The AI auto-subtitle tool automatically generates subtitles for your video and audio files.
The page says you can burn or hardcode subtitles into the video.
The page says you can download subtitle files in SRT, VTT, and TXT formats.
The page describes dynamic subtitles that emphasize key phrases in sync with the spoken audio.
The page says you can select subtitle fonts, sizes, styles, and colors.
The page says the tool can transcribe videos to text.
The subtitle editor says you can edit, reword, translate, or create new subtitles.
The page says you can add regular expressions when editing subtitles.
The page says you can change letter spacing, style, and fonts for subtitles.
The page says you can animate subtitles or highlight them to stress important information.
The page says you can download subtitles as separate files including SRT, VTT, and TXT.
The page describes the subtitle generator as powered by AI speech-recognition software.
The page says you can change video dimensions and aspect ratio with a single click.
The page lists social presets including YouTube (16:9) and Instagram Story (9:16).
Step 1 says you can upload your video files by dragging and dropping.
Step 2 says click 'Settings' then choose the size and crop to fit the frame's dimensions.
The page states VEED works with video formats including MP4, AVI, and MOV.
The page says you can select export resolution such as 4K, 1080p, and 720p.
The image-to-video AI generator lets you upload an image, describe the movement, and generate a video.
The page says no video editing skills are required to use the image-to-video generator.
The page mentions transforming product photos, digital art, and photographs into videos.
The page suggests creating product teasers and logo animations from photos.
The page says you can add animated stickers to videos using the editor.
The page suggests exploring other AI tools like an image generator and talking avatars.
The page says it lets you compare AI video models in one place.
The page describes this as a video models directory for generating AI videos from text.
The directory lists openai/sora-2 and openai/sora-2-pro.
The directory lists google/veo-3.1 and google/veo-3.1-fast.
The directory lists minimax/hailuo-2.3 and minimax/hailuo-2.3-fast.
The directory lists kwaivgi/kling-v2.6-pro and bytedance/seedance-1-lite.
